definition: to make into an institution : give character of an institution to, to incorporate into a structured and often highly formalized system
examples: … he has tried to institutionalize the bank's practices so that it can carry on when he no longer leads it.
In 2005, The New York Times revealed a set of NSA surveillance programs that, though considered shocking at the time, have since been institutionalized.

definition: to place in or commit to the care of a specialized institution (such as a psychiatric hospital)
examples: Thirty years ago doctors routinely advised parents to institutionalize children with Down syndrome and other disabilities …
